item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Let me make this a little more clear:
I did NOT make the xml data. I play a game that saves (literally) every action to XML log reports. I’m making a reader for it, because not all the data is displayed in theirs.

item.title: Reading multiple XML values of same element name
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Pretty sure you shouldn’t stack that many attributes in an element when you’re not encapsulating shit. Also, what do you expect you’re overwriting the same instance variable over and over again of course the last written value is going to be displayed.

Proper:

<defender>
<level>FuckYourShitCode</level>
<troops>
<troop>
<name>mr bullshit code</name>
</troop>
</troops>
</defender>

Also, why not JSON :(?

Read full topic
item.source: Reading multiple XML values of same element name

item.title: Reading multiple XML values of same element name
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

So I’m creating an XML reader, and I have a lot of XML elements with the same name, but when reading them, it only shows the data from the last element.

Example file:

<defender hero="Test" level="10000000"> <troop Id="17" total="750" dead="0"/> <troop Id="16" total="1250" dead="1250"/> <troop Id="3" total="750" dead="750"/> <troop Id="5" total="1000" dead="1000"/> <troop Id="6" total="350" dead="350"/> <troop Id="7" total="250" dead="250"/> <troop Id="9" total="200" dead="200"/> <troop Id="14" total="3750" dead="0"/> <troop Id="15" total="1875" dead="0"/> </defender>

And then when reading:

[code=java]
public void readTroop(NodeList troop) {
int type = 0;
int total = 0;
int loss = 0;

    for (int i = 0; i < troop.getLength(); i++) {
        Node readNode = troop.item(i);

        if (readNode.getNodeType() == Node.ELEMENT_NODE) {
            Element readElement = (Element) readNode;
            try {
                type = Integer.parseInt(readElement.getAttribute("Id"));
                total = Integer.parseInt(readElement.getAttribute("total"));
                loss = Integer.parseInt(readElement.getAttribute("dead"));
            } catch(Exception e) {
                
            }
        }
    }
    trace("Troop: " + getTroopName(type) + " Amount: " + total + " Casualty: " + loss);
}[/code]

And then the output:

I based my XML parsing off of:
http://www.mkyong.com/java/how-to-read-xml-file-in-java-dom-parser/
So it may not be the best.

Read full topic
